Description: Ostracon, fragment of the body of a light-brown pottery ribbed vessel, the interior bears traces of a dark-brown resinous deposit, the exterior is covered with a red-brown slip and faint traces of four lines of Coptic text written in black ink.
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (393347) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/393347)
